description: OneAgent automatically monitors host, its processes, services and applications but you can switch off monitoring, disable full-stack monitoring or auto-injection.

autoInjection.description: An auto-injection disabled with [oneagentctl](https://dt-url.net/oneagentctl) takes precedence over this setting and cannot be changed from the Dynatrace web UI.

enabled.description: Turn on monitoring to gain visibility into this host, its processes, services, and applications.

fullStack.description:
Dynatrace uses full-stack monitoring by default, to monitor every aspect of your environment, including all processes, services, and applications detected on your hosts. 

If you turn off full-stack monitoring, Dynatrace will only monitor your infrastructure. You will lose access to application performance, user experience data, code-level visibility and PurePath insights. 

To learn more, visit [Infrastructure Monitoring mode](https://www.dynatrace.com/support/help/shortlink/infrastructure).

Please note that changing the monitoring mode will impact the license consumption of this OneAgent. To learn more, visit [Host units](https://dt-url.net/hi03uns).
fullStack.documentation:
Full-stack monitoring will be applied to a process after its restart.

The OneAgent's monitoring mode will automatically overwrite this setting whenever it is changed with [oneagentctl](https://dt-url.net/oneagentctl) or the OneAgent comes online.
